content:
traveling is a vital supplement for some students education because it enriches understanding beyond textbooks PERIOD For those who lack the ability or money for trips it takes a secondhand account to provide the thrill of travel PERIOD For many New Orleans can be one of those hardtobudget but necessary trips PERIOD

In New Orleans the majority of porches are occupied by  a.m PERIOD People sit in wicker lounge chairs chatting with others seated in wooden rocking chairs while ceiling fans lazily turn in the breeze PERIOD Late morning in New Orleans epitomizes the Southern stereotype of relaxed laidback living PERIOD

But the city has much to offer beyond that easy southern stereotype PERIOD

New Orleans isnt a Southern city PERIOD It is a city that just happens to be in the South said Jeremy Ruiz bartender at Cajun Mikes Pub n Grub who was born and raised in New Orleans and intimately understands the citys unique character PERIOD

The city was built on a swamp so its sinking PERIOD If you dig two feet youll hit the water table PERIOD For most places they slapped down some mud and said Hey theres a good spot to build a big house he said PERIOD

Sightseeing in New Orleans involves walking around the Garden District PERIOD In this historic neighborhood enormous colonialera mansions compete for visitors attention each one outdoing the previous in grandeur in a sharp contrast to New Orleans crumbling infrastructure PERIOD

In the city exposed tree roots bulge over sidewalk seams often breaking through the cement PERIOD Twoblocklong puddles randomly line the streets even if it has not rained in days PERIOD Walking driving and biking become a slalom race through sinkholes cracks loose blocks and the occasional fountain spurting from the sewers PERIOD

New Orleans is an amazing city even though its corrupt PERIOD Theres not much money for public works even though there are city taxes said local resident Alex Payne PERIOD The thing about New Orleans is that its part of another time PERIOD Thats its appeal PERIOD You come here and its a different pace things work differently so people have a different type of social interaction. for residents and tourists alike the evening hours are often the beginning rather than end of the day PERIOD The city has a neverending list of musical events which are great opportunities for socializing PERIOD The music scene is legendary because of its wideranging styles and venues PERIOD Jazz concerts play in the French Quarter nightly impromptu brass bands perform at Hornets games and a cappella quartets sing on street corners PERIOD

For those who seek a variety of music Frenchmen Street runs one block east of the French Quarter and has more than  bars amid venues in a threeblock stretch PERIOD For those who enjoy festivals events such as Bach Around the Clock unite more than  musicians for a 24hour nonstop concert PERIOD

While most visitors come for the infamous nightlife many are frequently surprised by the citys eclectic and often scandalous history PERIOD Local history is a lesseradvertised aspect of New Orleans tourism but numerous activities teach visitors about the citys colorful past PERIOD Guided tours trolley rides and museums provide ample opportunity to learn about its history including vampires and ghosts code noir public execution political corruption organized crime and religious scandal PERIOD

One of the most popular walking tours the Ghost Tour in the French Quarter encompasses three city blocks and retells four particularly gruesome stories from the nineteenth century when street riots and serial killers were common PERIOD Museums such as the Ogden Museum of Southern Art and the Confederate Museum are other sources of local and regional history not often found in American history textbooks PERIOD

For those seeking more than a drunken party on a beach New Orleans offers culture music and history in a setting that defies simplistic explanations PERIOD

The Daily Emerald is the news division of Emerald Media Group University of Oregons independent student media organization PERIOD
